info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 7:37AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...MIXED WINTERY PRECIPITATION WILL CONTINUE TODAY WITH MORNING DENSE FOG... Showers are continuing this morning and with temperatures hovering right around freezing, we are seeing a mix of wintery precipitation. Throughout the greater Portland and Vancouver Metro area, central Willamette Valley and the lower Columbia area along I-5 will see periods of snow, rain/snow mix, snow grains and even some small hail. While more of a wet snow, spotty accumulations of up to 1 inch are possible, especially along the sides of roads and grassy surfaces. Elevations above 500 ft are most likely to see acccumulating snow. As temperatures warm through the day, snow will become less likely, though periods of mixed rain and snow are still possible. For current road conditions visit www.tripcheck.org or dial 5-1-1. In addition to this winter precipitation, dense fog is forming in areas which is leading to reduced visibility to one quarter mile or less. This fog is not necessarily widespread but may come up suddenly. Be alert if traveling, wear reflective clothing, and leave ample space between you and vehicles around you.
